pageContext.claim: “@FoxNews daytime ratings have completely collapsed. Weekend daytime even WORSE. Very sad to watch this happen, but they forgot what made them successful, what got them there. They forgot the Golden Goose. The biggest difference between the 2016 Election, and 2020, was @FoxNews!”
pageContext.analysis: Trump, still angry because Fox News had (correctly) called Arizona for Biden on election night, tweeted this as he also retweeted a dozen posts critical of Fox News, including ones in which followers say that they had switched to other outlets like Newsmax and One America News Network. But his claims about Fox News ratings are incorrect. Newsmax saw a ratings uptick during election week but "Fox News said that its ratings hit milestones too, Deadline reported. "In a release sent out Tuesday [two days before Trump's tweet], Fox News, citing figures from Nielsen, said that its total day viewership last week was 3.2 million, the highest since the start of the Iraq war. On Tuesday, Hannity was the most watched cable program with 5.2 million viewers, followed by Tucker Carlson Tonight with 4.7 million and The Ingraham Angle with 3.8 million."
